snippet: Human rights groups say that xenophobic violence has reached “alarming proportions” in Greece since the rise of Golden Dawn, an extremist party, in the June election.
abstract: Human rights groups warn that xenophobic violence has reached alarming proportions in Greece since the extremist right-wing Golden Dawn party gained an electoral foothold in Parliament in June; groups say that members of the party and its sympathizers have been emboldened by political support for their anti-immigrant ideology, and that the authorities have failed to stop the trend.

byline.contributor: Dimitris Bounias and Niki Kitsantonis contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Human rights groups say that xenophobic violence has reached “alarming proportions” in Greece since the rise of Golden Dawn, an extremist party, in the June election.

headline.seo: As Golden Dawn Rises in Greece, Anti-Immigrant Violence Follows
headline.main: Greek Far Right Hangs a Target on Immigrants
headline.print_headline: Greek Far Right Hangs A Target On Immigrants
